result.execSummary:
The defendant Marques E Zarate was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations. Must have psychological evaluation and cooperate with treatment plan.   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family) unless approved by agent and victim.   DNA sample is not required by law, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marques E Zarate

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marques E Zarate in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Marques E Zarate in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.  Transcript filed: 12-23-2015 vw.
15CM638 will be DRI as part of the negotiations with the felony matters. The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. In 15cf576, Ct 1 - 2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES; Ct 2- 2 yrs IC 3 yrs es consec, Ct 5: 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES - I/S - 2 yrs probation. 15CF680, Ct 1: 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES/STAYED - 2 yrs conc probation; No contact w/victims unless approved by agent and victims, no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's, FT emp.

BTC: 15CM638 is dismissed and read in.
         15CF576, Ct 1 - Total sentence is 2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES, conc with Ct 2
                          Ct 2 - Total sentence is 5 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES
                          Ct 5 - Total sentence is 2 yrs WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES/STAYED. 3 yrs probation
         15CF680, Ct 1 - Total sentence is 2 ys WPS bifurcated as 1 yr IC, 1 yr ES conc with Cts 1 & 2 in 15CF576

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs including Domestic abuse assessment
DNA sample & costs in Cts 2 in 15CF576 and 15CF680
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as psych eval and cooperate with treatment plan
No contact with victim unless approved by agent and victim

FAW/vote

NOT eligible for CIP or SAP

Defendant Marques E Zarate in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Marques E Zarate in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defendant Marques E Zarate in court with attorney Gretchen G. Rosenke.  Defendant Marques E Zarate in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Upon plea to 15CF576, Cts 1, 2, & 5. Bal are DRI. The State agrees to recommend on Ct 2-5 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES-consec to any other time, Ct 1-2 yrs WPS equal bifurcation, consec to Ct 1, Ct 5-2 yrs I/S equal bifurcation-3 yrs probation. In 15CF680, the State files amended information. Upon plea to Ct 1 of amended info, Ct 2 is DRI. The State recommends 2 yrs I/S prison of equal bifurcation - 2 yrs probation conc with Ct 5 in 15CF576. No contact unless agreed to by victim and agent; no alc/cs unless prescribed; AODA/FT, FT emp.
P- NC to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendant. VG   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
